intro: Myzorrhiza tacnaensis, commonly known as the Tacna myzorrhiza, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of southern Peru. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
